item.title: 2026+: What to Do When Everyone Can Do Everything
item.description:
2025 was the year of simplification. Complex workflows collapsed into a few buttons. The distance between “I want this” and “done” is approaching zero. Soon we’ll be generating things through neural interfaces paired with AI agents. (Screenshot this.)

Now everyone can make anything - and everyone does. Content factories pump out AI-generated slop at industrial scale. Algorithms lock us into bubbles of perfectly curated comfort: soft, familiar, frictionless. Reels, shorts, endless scroll. Attention has become reflexive. In this ocean of noise, good ideas drown as quickly as bad ones.

item.title: AI Safety vs. Security: The Critical Distinction Your Organization Can't Afford to Ignore
item.description:
Are you treating AI safety and AI security as the same thing? If so, your organization might be missing critical vulnerabilities that could compromise both your operations and compliance posture.

The Dangerous Misconception

While many languages use the same word for both concepts, the OECD emphasizes that AI safety and security are distinct yet interconnected domains that require different approaches and frameworks. This distinction isn’t just academic - it has real implications for how you protect your organization.
